intro: Codonoboea alba, commonly known as the white codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
